course.subject: MATH
course.name: Accelerated Calculus
course.description: A concise introduction to one-variable calculus. Topics include functions, limits, derivatives, definite and indefinite integrals and their applications, infinite sequences and series, Taylor series, first order differential equations.
course.prerequisites: Level 5* or 5** in HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M2
course.exclusions: A passing grade in AL Applied Mathematics / AL Pure Mathematics; MATH 1013, MATH 1014, MATH 1018, MATH 1023, MATH 1024

reviews.author: Globas
reviews.title: Danger Ahead!! Better to choose MATH 1013 instead!
reviews.comment_content: The course is teaching the content of both MATH 1013 and 1014. Epsilon-delta proof of limits is difficult. Also some other new concepts which is not a part of M2.
reviews.comment_teaching: Avery's teaching is good. His board-writing is clear. However, the lecture notes does not help a lot. Homework is not that useful, even the past paper. The TA prepares some difficult materials for us to learn, resulted in bad understanding.
reviews.comment_grading: Be careful before enrolment! Exam is rather difficult!
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is reasonable. Last semester we have final-exam 100% grading scheme, where homework is not counted. However, doing homework is still an essential measure to guarantee the study progress. Besides, there is no WeBWorK. But I think if this course is offed again, WeBWorK will be added because the homework is really not adequate.

reviews.author: Luis
reviews.comment_content:
It covers mainly the basics of Analysis of functions. Later on there will also be insights into basic integration up to differentiating functions with a plynom of grade 4 and above.
Students learn about all the main content of Calculus I and II in course. Therefore it is very time intesifying and should be absloved only with prior math knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: As everything is written on internet presentations, it is not necessary to go to the teaching. I aquired my knowledge mostly online.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is hard, but quite fair, due to the fact that the exam only targets exactly the topics that were targeted by the Presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: If youre good in Math it is not a lot of workload. Though, if basic abilities are missing it can get challengeging. You should consider spending at least 10 hours into the course weekly if you want to master it with an A

reviews.author: Etho
reviews.title: Dual Program
reviews.comment_content:
Part I:
1. Basic Concepts in Calculus
- limit
- continuity
- intermediate value theorem
- extreme value theorem
- derivatives
- mean value theorem
- chain rule/ substitution rule
- fundamental theorem of calculus

2. Integration
- integration techniques: by parts/ trigonometric substitutions/ partial fractions
- application of integrals
- numerical integration
- improper integration

Part II:
3. Infinite Sequence and Series
- limit of infinite series
- convergence/ divergence
- tests: divergent test/ integral test/ comparison test/ limit comparison test/ ratio test/ root test/ alternating series test

4. Power Series
- radius of convergence
- Taylor’s theorem
- Taylor’s Series

5. Parametric Curves
- slope of tangents
- polar coordinates

6. Vectors
- dot/ cross product
- equations of lines snd planes in R3

7. Differential Equations
- 1st order ODE
reviews.comment_teaching: Avery is super nice. He was so willing to answer your questions whenever you have any problems. Discussion between students and Avery was fun. He always went into some higher level of maths that encouraged us to explore more.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 5%
Assignment 15%
Mid-term exam 30%
Final exam 50%

My result:
Attendance 5/5
Assignment 14.5/15
Mid-term exam 42/50 (I didn’t have time to study)
Final exam 100/100 (The problem on differential equation is quite challenging although he did not have time to go through the lecture notes)
Final grade: A
You need to score super high in order to get an A+
reviews.comment_workload: Light Workload with only 6 sets of assignments. But you need to do more practice in order to get good grades. One midterm and one final. Similar as other math courses.
